column4: it's the ALC202A chipset.  i think alsa may support it, but i'm not sure
it should work in the latest alsa with the intel 8x0 driver
how to change driver from oss to alsa in ubuntu AFAIK i am right on question
what does this command report: "asoundconf list" ?
are you in ubuntu or fedora now?
i am helping a friend who is on ubuntu, i am on fedora
i am thinking of invitng him here
ah and he typed asoundconf, not you, right?
well it looks like his card is detected.  have him type "sudo lshw -class sound | grep driver="
configuration: driver=Intel ICH        <---sudo lshw -class sound | grep driver=
hmm ok, what about "lsmod | grep intel8x0"

ok.  well his card should be working.  there might be a switch in the mixer he needs to check (like analog/digital output) to get it to work properly.  other than that, it's detected by ubuntu and the driver has been loaded
type 'gnome-volume-control' and go to the Switches tab.  try switching on/off the options till the sound works
yes, ty, i am trying that
